required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Video Telehealth Gait Retraining for Running-Related Knee Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Video Telehealth Gait Retraining Program Versus a Standard Exercise and Education Program for Patients With Running-Related Knee Pain

collaborator.agency: Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: In this randomized control trial, participants with running-related knee pain will be randomly assigned to either an intervention group or a control group. Participants in the intervention group will receive a telehealth gait retraining intervention, an at-home exercise program, a return to running protocol, and standard physical therapy. Participants in the control group will receive an at-home exercise program, a return to running protocol, and standard physical therapy. Data will be collected before intervention, at 10-weeks, and at 14-weeks to determine efficacy of the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Worst knee pain during running assessed by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.description: Worst knee pain intensity in the past 7 days recorded using a 0 to 10 cm visual analogue scale where 0 equals no pain and 10 indicates the most severe pain the patient could imagine. Higher numbers equal greater levels of reported pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Worst knee pain after running assessed by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.description: Worst knee pain intensity in the past 7 days recorded using a 0 to 10 cm visual analogue scale where 0 equals no pain and 10 indicates the most severe pain the patient could imagine. Higher numbers equal greater levels of reported pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Foot strike pattern during running measured with motion capture
primary_outcome.description: Portion of the foot that makes initial contact with the ground at the start of each stance phase during running.

secondary_outcome.measure: University of Wisconsin Running Injury and Recovery Index
secondary_outcome.description: A 9-item questionnaire (range 0-36, higher scores indicate more function) that measures a runners assessment of running ability after sustaining a running-related injury.

secondary_outcome.measure: Worst non-knee pain during running assessed by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Worst pain intensity in a region other than the knee during running in the past 7 days recorded using a 0 to 10 cm visual analogue scale where 0 equals no pain and 10 indicates the most severe pain the patient could imagine. Higher numbers equal greater levels of reported pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Worst knee pain overall assessed by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Worst knee pain intensity experienced overall in the past 7 days recorded using a 0 to 10 cm visual analogue scale where 0 equals no pain and 10 indicates the most severe pain the patient could imagine. Higher numbers equal greater levels of reported pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee function assessed with the single assessment numeric evaluation method
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate their knee function on a scale of 0 (least normal) to 100 (most normal).

secondary_outcome.measure: Knee function assessed with the anterior knee pain scale
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate their level of pain, disability, and impairment associated with their knee injury using a 13-item questionnaire (range 0-100, higher scores indicate better function).

secondary_outcome.measure: Worst knee pain during running assessed by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Worst knee pain intensity in the past 7 days recorded using a 0 to 10 cm visual analogue scale where 0 equals no pain and 10 indicates the most severe pain the patient could imagine. Higher numbers equal greater levels of reported pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Worst knee pain after running assessed by Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: Worst knee pain intensity in the past 7 days recorded using a 0 to 10 cm visual analogue scale where 0 equals no pain and 10 indicates the most severe pain the patient could imagine. Higher numbers equal greater levels of reported pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Foot strike pattern during running measured with motion capture
secondary_outcome.description: Portion of the foot that makes initial contact with the ground at the start of each stance phase during running.

arm_group.description: Participants in the experimental group will receive a telehealth gait retraining intervention in addition to standard physical therapy rehabilitation for running-related knee pain, which includes: an at-home exercise program, a return to running protocol, and standard physical therapy evaluations.

Participants in the control group will receive standard physical therapy rehabilitation for running-related knee pain, which includes: an at-home exercise program, a return to running protocol, and standard physical therapy evaluations.

intervention.description: Telehealth gait retraining is a novel approach to train participants to adopt a non-rearfoot foot strike pattern during running via telecommunications. During telehealth gait retraining, video of a participant's running form are sent to clinicians over a mobile device app and running form feedback is given. This process is repeated once a week for four weeks and then every other week until week 8.
Participants receiving standard Physical Therapy will visit the Physical Therapy Clinic every 2 to 3 weeks to be treated by a Physical Therapist.
The Return to Running protocol is a six-phase running volume progression to re-introduce running slowly and safely after experiencing a running-related injury.
The At Home Exercise Program consists of 4 lower leg and foot exercises that participants can perform on their own time.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Active Duty Soldier or Cadet between the ages of 18 to 60 years old
- Knee pain that occurs during and/or after running that was not due to a recent acute trauma (such as an accident or a fall) and that is a pain intensity of at least a '3' and no greater than a '7' on a numeric pain rating scale with '0' meaning "no pain" and '10' meaning the "worst possible pain"
- Fluent in speaking and reading English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently on an Army running limiting profile for something other than knee pain
- Presence of rheumatoid or neurological diseases
- Plans to deploy or permanent change of station (PCS) within 4 months
- Current lower extremity injury other than knee pain
- History of traumatic knee injury (such as a surgery, ligament tear, or meniscal tear)
- Current pregnancy
- Inability to perform 20 unassisted single leg heel raises on each leg
- A non-rearfoot strike pattern during running
- Showing signs of ligamentous instability, meniscus pathology, or knee effusion

facility.name: Keller Army Community Hospital - Arvin Physical Therapy
